[Home](./index.md) &gt; [@thi.ng/malloc](./malloc.md) &gt; [IMemPool](./malloc.imempool.md)

## IMemPool interface

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export interface IMemPool extends IRelease 
```

## Methods

|  Method | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [calloc(size, fill)](./malloc.imempool.calloc.md) | Similar to <code>malloc()</code>, but if allocation was successful also clears the allocated block w/ <code>fill</code> value (default: 0). |
|  [callocAs(type, num, fill)](./malloc.imempool.callocas.md) | Similar to <code>mallocAs()</code>, but if allocation was successful also clears the allocated block w/ <code>fill</code> value (default: 0). |
|  [free(ptr)](./malloc.imempool.free.md) | Takes a memory block address and attempts to return the block to the pool. Depending on <code>compact</code> config option, this operation might cause compaction of consecutive free memory blocks to help counter fragmentation. Returns true if block has been freed.<!-- -->It's the user's responsibility to ensure that freed blocks are not used any further after calling <code>free()</code>. Undefined behavior, or worse, pool corruption might ensue! |
|  [freeAll()](./malloc.imempool.freeall.md) | Frees all previously allocated blocks and resests allocator state. |
|  [malloc(size)](./malloc.imempool.malloc.md) | Attempts to allocate a new memory block of given <code>size</code> (in bytes). Returns block address or zero if unsuccessful (insufficient memory). |
|  [mallocAs(type, num)](./malloc.imempool.mallocas.md) | Takes a <code>Type</code> enum and element count <code>num</code> (in units of given type), calls <code>malloc()</code> and if successful wraps allocated block as typed array of given <code>type</code>. Returns undefined if allocation failed. |
|  [realloc(ptr, size)](./malloc.imempool.realloc.md) | Attempts to reallocate given memory block to new <code>size</code> (in bytes). If new <code>size</code> is larger than the original, attempts to grow block or else allocates new one and moves contents to new address. If new size is smaller than original, the existing block might be split (depending on <code>split</code> &amp; <code>minSplit</code> config options) and the unused part freed. Returns new address if successful or zero if re-allocation failed (insufficient menory). |
|  [reallocArray(arr, num)](./malloc.imempool.reallocarray.md) | Similar to <code>realloc()</code>, but takes a typed array (one previously allocated with <code>mallocAs()</code> or <code>callocAs()</code>) and if successul returns new typed array of same type. Returns undefined on failure. |
|  [stats()](./malloc.imempool.stats.md) | Returns an information object of the pool's state. |
